summary: Email correspondence from August 15, 2019, regarding efforts to expedite phone toll returns from carriers (Sprint, AT&T, T-Mobile) in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation. The emails involve a U.S. Attorney's Office contact requesting assistance and a colleague responding about making calls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email is in connection with the investigation into his death.

events.title: Request for phone toll records in Epstein death investigation
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office contact requests assistance to expedite phone toll returns from carriers (Sprint, AT&T, T-Mobile) for the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: On August 15, 2019, a U.S. Attorney's Office contact requested help expediting phone toll returns from major carriers (Sprint, AT&T, T-Mobile) for the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.
The request indicates an active investigation into Epstein's death was ongoing at that time, focusing on obtaining phone records.
The correspondence shows coordination between individuals (names redacted) to contact phone carriers as part of the investigative process.
